result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric S Braun was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.

AS OF 12/09 THIS WAS AMENDED:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: the Washington County Probation

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
No contact with Co-Defendant or any known drug dealers/users.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - nonworking hours. Standard release. Defendant to serve 30 days and the Last 60 days are STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion.

Defendant Eric S Braun in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Redetzke makes statements. Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
3 1/2 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
18 months of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 2 Years concurrent to the Washington County Probation
Conditions of Probation:
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
No contact with Co-Defendant or any known drug dealers/users .
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 90 days NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence Thursday 11/12/2015 @ 6:00 pm.  Defendant to serve the first 30 days, last 60 days are STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 08:30 am
